info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 3:38PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Teller and west central El Paso Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 338 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cripple Creek, or 21 miles west of Colorado Springs, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodland Park, Manitou Springs, Cripple Creek, Green Mountain Falls, Pikes Peak, Crystola, Chipita Park and Cascade. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
